extendedInfo.description: This interactive field guide to the wildlife and plants of 100 National Parks includes all the birds, mammals, reptiles and amphibians you'll encounter while visiting a park as well as helps you identify native trees and wildflowers. NOTE: This app requires an active internet connection.Created for the National Parks Conservation Association (NPCA), the guide is also full of useful information about each park such as major sites within it, directions, hours and fees, links, and phone numbers to make reservations or get more information.The NPCA National Parks Field Guides will help you do all sorts of things--- find out what species of bird you just saw on the beach in Cape Cod, learn what grizzly bears eat for dinner in Denali, know when porcupine mating season begins in the Shenandoah or identify the trees you find in Yosemite.It's comprehensive-- all native birds and animals are included, along with photos, in-depth descriptions, audio, field marks and more. Users can also search for Endangered Species or Poisonous/Dangerous species native to any of the 100 national parks featured.The 100 parks included are a representative sampling of the hundreds of parks in the national park system that support critical wildlife habitat â from seashores and recreational areas to riverways and historical sites.Intended for novices and experts alike, the guideâs design and content selection maximize its accessibility and ease-of-use so that users can easily find within the guide the wildlife they are most likely to encounter. No other field guide matches the content and capabilities of this mobile field guide.The field guide was developed for the National Parks Conservation Association by eNature.com. At the heart of this mobile app is eNatureâs comprehensive, geographically segmentable database of U.S. wildlife, both animals and plants. eNature.comâs core content of wildlife information includes almost 6,000 individual species and originated with the same data set used to create the printed Audubon Field Guides. All the data has been carefully reviewed and vetted by leading biologists, zoologists and other natural history specialists. eNature.com has consistently been one of the Internet's most-visited sites for nature and wildlife information and has won numerous awards and accolades.

reviews.title: Annoying.
reviews.comment: It keeps coming up with our national parks need you and u cant get out unless u completely leave! Urgg its slow and im unistalling
reviews.author: Anna Watts

reviews.title: Could be much better
reviews.comment: The pictures are good as are the descriptions. The problem is that the lists only download a small section and when you try to get to the bottom to tell it to continue uploading, it scrolls back up to the top of the list. After 20 minutes of fighting I am giving up and uninstalling. Too bad it looks like it might be a nice app.
reviews.author: Kim Henshaw

reviews.title: Gets Hung up too much
reviews.comment: Downloaded this for a trip to Great Basin National Park and it stinks that you must have internet to use it because you can\'t get a cell signal there. At home it gets stuck on the opening page forever. This app should be much better and work without a cell signal.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Difficult to use and useless in the park
reviews.comment: What program designed for the remoteness of National Parks requires Internet connection? Once you set foot in the park, away from reception/wifi the program is useless. when you are back at civilisation the program is not user friendly to the point of not being useful. The full list can\'t be used because as it refreshes it keeps taking you back to the top. Anything after c is unreachable. The alternative is filtering, which requires you to know enough about the animal. If I knew I wouldn\'t need the app!
reviews.author: Tsachi Avrahami

reviews.title: Great except internet needed
reviews.comment: this is a great program however it needs internet all the time not just to download. would be much more functional if you could download the park you needed so you can use it offline!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Informative, BUT...
reviews.comment: When trying to scroll down to read the info I must maintain contact with the screen or when I let go it springs back to the top of the page. WILL NOT STAY SO INFO CAN BE READ.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good info but buggy
reviews.comment: App needs a lot of work. Scrolling is terrible, pictures don\'t line up right and overlap drop-down menus. It\'s a good start though.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: This is a great app to learn anout animals and plants would recommend it
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Thunderbolt user
reviews.comment: As with another reviewer scrolling will bounce back to the beginning-please fix asap.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: never finished installiing
reviews.comment: Downloaded it and waited till after installed. Tried to open and use it, but never got beyond the cover page because whenever I pulled it out it showed installing and then stopped.
reviews.author: Edward Li

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: This is a great interesting app
reviews.author: Jonathan Griffiths

reviews.title: Can\'t read list
reviews.comment: Would be a great app if you were able to scroll down without it jumping up to the top of the list, can\'t read off list. Please fix glitch.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Won\'t connect
reviews.comment: I have wifi and a full data connection and the app cannot find a network connection?
reviews.author: Kristy Lytle

reviews.title: No scrolling problem
reviews.comment: Just started using so don\'t know yet if it will get the 5th star. No scrolling problem on Droid Bionic.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Moves to SD card. Great for anyone interested in nature in our national parks. Wish there will someday also cover state parks and forests by region. Great!
reviews.author: A Google User
